  sgcool_label_text: Tanah Impian (Dream Land) is a series of prints based on images drawn from Indonesian popular culture
 spanning 100 years. The project was conceived in 2014
 the year of the elections in Indonesia when nationalist rhetoric dominated public consciousness
 Artist collective Krack Studio sifted through a mass of research and archival material
 eventually selecting 24 images that referenced the idea of the Indonesian Dream and / or told an interesting story about changing definitions of the ‘Nation’. Ranging from political posters to advertisements
 comic strips
 movie posters and magazines
 these images
 reconstructed and re-imagined by the artist collective
 chronicle Indonesia’s evolving aspirations
 desires and identity
 as well as how Indonesia has been perceived and imaged for the ‘Western’ gaze.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: Tanah Impian (Dream Land) is a series of prints based on images drawn from Indonesian popular culture, spanning 100 years. The project was conceived in 2014, the year of the elections in Indonesia when nationalist rhetoric dominated public consciousness, Artist collective Krack Studio sifted through a mass of research and archival material, eventually selecting 24 images that referenced the idea of the Indonesian Dream and / or told an interesting story about changing definitions of the ‘Nation’. Ranging from political posters to advertisements, comic strips, movie posters and magazines, these images, reconstructed and re-imagined by the artist collective, chronicle Indonesia’s evolving aspirations, desires and identity, as well as how Indonesia has been perceived and imaged for the ‘Western’ gaze.
